Reviews.Title: “Easter trip”
Reviews.Author: Magdalene B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the confortel Barcelona hotel: 1) in terms of cleanliness I am a very fussy person, but I have to say there was nothing to complaint about. Every day the cleaning lady did her job properly. 2) service at the reception desk was very good. All staff were very friendly and helpful. 3) location wise: it was perfect for us as it is away from the city centre and drunken tourist. A very quite and safe area. Not far to the sea front. Numerous buses going to the city centre. Though we walked( if you are fit we would recommend walking rather than taking a bus or metro). There are many good restaurants near by and local shops. The area itself is clean. 4) certainly it is a good value for what you pay. Our only disappointment was that the pool was closed, though this would would make a sense due to the weather. 5) we had a room on the 7 th floor with a sea view, decent size, good size bathroom. Unfortunately, Walls are not sound proofed. On one occasion I had to knock on next door as people slammed door every minute after 9pm, and kindly remind them that they are not alone in the hotel and should behave. In our 8 days stay I only did this once and it worked. Unfortunately, this hotel is family friendly so if you don't want kids running in a corridor or slamming doors make sure you ask at the reception to try to allocate you away from family rooms. Despite this one incident we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but 4 star? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: Rav J
Reviews.Content: First of all, a warning. Trip Advisor says this is a 4 star hotel but the map that the hotel provided when I got there gave it 3 stars. Pros: Nice hotel, clean rooms, quite stylish All towels, shower gels and soaps were replenished without me asking Near the Ramblas de Poblenou 10 min walk from the Llacuna and Poblenou metro stations 10 min walk from the beach Decent speed wi-fi Cons: Its hard to find a place to eat nearby after 2am (when I got back from the Barca game) Not really 4 star standard The pool and gym a little disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Service & Facilities - Worst I Have Ever Experienced! Room fine.”
Reviews.Author: Freemermaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March 2012. The hotel was nice and modern, the room and bathroom very clean and simply furnished but the service and facilities were atrocious. Although I spoke basic spanish, the staff (except for Carlos & Bea) were unbelievably unwilling to help, you almost knew in the end that every question you asked would be answered with 'no'. There is no currency exchange (except for Euro to Euro - not sure why you would want to change Euro for Euros?), the menu in the restaurant has a ridiculously limited choice and the food is bland and uninteresting. The service in the restaurant is shockingly bad and noticeably unhelpful. One evening my husband came in for a coffee at 11.30pm after watching Barcelona play Granada at Nou Camp Stadium in the freezing cold. We rang the bell on our table for service and were completed ignored by this older guy who seemed to run the kitchen and bar/coffee area. He served another table who arrived at the same time. When he ignored us, I said "Excuse me", he walked away from me, went to the kitchen door, turned around and said "Cerrado (closed)" and turned all the lights off!! I could of understood it if we had been drinking or noisy but we were stone cold sobre! Reception staff also gave us copious amounts of totally inaccurate tourist information. Beware this is a very poor excuse for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KieranB3
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, comfortable hotel, Staff extremely helpful and friendly and well up on local knowledge and tourist attractions. The Rooftop Pool & Sun Terrace was a real bonus with panoramic views of the city. The room beautifully designed with clean modern lines but yet very comfortable. Top marks to Room cleaning staff who not only replenished the towels and bathroom products and changed the bed daily but also took time to nicely arrange our own bathroom products and tidy clothes. Located 8 min walk from the beach and close to all public transport this hotel although not city centre proved an excellent base for our Barcelona Trip and we shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “Two day visit”
Reviews.Author: Gail H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and easy to get around. In a pleasant area with plenty of bars to eat and drink all reasonably priced. Although we were surprised they shut at midnight. Trip was for a Barcelona football match then we drove down the coast for 5 days visiting friends. Thoroughly enjoyed the game especially as they won. Rooms lovely and modern and spotlessly clean. As in previous reviews would have welcomed tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Staff we found professional but quite surly. Thought parking price was quite expensive. Not sure if we would stay again at this hotel but we would definitely visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “confortel barcelona, great stay”
Reviews.Author: skinnyEngland
Reviews.Content: modern large room, clean and smart,good sea/city views. 2 mins walk to several local tapas bars and eateries. 5 mins to beach or ten mins walk to shopping complex.not 1 complaint adequate gym , not that i bothered and pool was closed but dont care about that either.

Reviews.Title: “will come again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from metro. very nice, modern and clean hotel. very big room, great bed. good bathroom. the hotel's staff is very nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Rhea1992
Reviews.Content: Just finished my stay here with my partner and 2 other friends. The location couldn't be better, close to everything you'd want to see and visit in Barcelona. Lots of bars and cafes around too. On the other hand the service was poor, reception staff VERY rude, especially one individual which I managed to find the name 'carmina' she was so rude I couldnt believe it. On another occasion my boyfriend woke in the middle of the night very thirsty so we rang reception and they tried to charge us 12 EUROS for ONE bottle of water, the same brand of water from local shops that was 15 CENTS. I was appalled. The rooms are nice, pool was shut so that was disappointing. Close to the beach, there's a restaurant that no one seems to use. If it hadn't of been for the very rude staff and water incident, I would have enjoyed my stay here much more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: vntrinh31
Reviews.Content: Although a few metro stops away from the center of Barcelona, this is a great hotel for the price (roughly a 5-10 minute walk from the metro stop). Spacious rooms and bathrooms - with clean amenities for your use. Internet is free and fast. There is a great heater/ ac in your room so you can adjust at your own preference. I had a great view, looking into the city (and I could see Sagrada Familia!) I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and consider staying here again when I come back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Palafito86
Reviews.Content: It's clean, modern and has decent sized rooms. The staff are both pleasant and professional. There are plenty of bars, cafes and shops nearby on la rambla del poblenou and the Metro is 5 mins walk away. If you want to be a stone's throw away from the main tourist sights then this may not be the place for you but if you are happy to use public transport then this should definitely be an option. It met all my needs and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Moo86
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay in this hotel Located in a lovely area with loads of cafes and bars, and very nice local shops. Metro station only few blocks away. Nice view of barcelona in our room on the 7th floor Everything was spotless! Would totally recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great location”
Reviews.Author: Edrocket
Reviews.Content: Been in Barcelona several times, including staying in five start accomodation.. This one is the same in terms of room quality and space. One difference: the price. Make sure you book the 7th floor, with balcony overeeing the sea and cityview. Well equipped too with separet shower and jacuzzi bath. The area is quiet and around the block is the local Rambla with lots of restaurants, beach is on walking distance same as the Metro that bring you into the city in minutes. We had a excellent stay and I hilghly recommend this hotel. Good service

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow777
Reviews.Content: I didn't want a hotel in the centre of the city because I drove to Barcelona and finding parking on streets in the center is almost impossible. So I was looking for a hotel with quite area, not far from the centre and possibility of finding free parking on the street so this was the place for it. Hotel itself was nice and in accordance with 4 star level. Room was spacious and staff was helpful. Price was great too. All in all a good experience and I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ike N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week before Christmas 2011. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Location was fine. Walking distance to beachfront. Even walked to centre of town (love walking). Not far from Metro or tram stops. Room was upgraded - had balcony and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Short barcelona visit.”
Reviews.Author: Cristian E
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay was great,the hotel is very modern. I did not use any other facilities, the rooms were clean and staff at times helpful. I've only slept at the hotel, as I was out most days in town exploring the city. Hotel location wasn't bad but also not so great, you will see that the neighborhood isn't the best. The hotel is located about 7/10minutes walking distance from Llacuna metro station on the yellow line, which is good for connection to Estacion francia (if you are traveling outside the city) and Barceloneta if you fancy a walk by the beach. Some local residents have told me that the area becomes a bit wild during the weekends due to few night clubs in and around the hotel, but i cannot comment on that as my stay was during weekday. If you are a young traveler or do not speak the language I would recommend getting back to the hotel by taxi at certain times. I would recommend the hotel for short a short stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: essex1london
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas eve 2011 quite late and the receptionist was not very friendly !! She took ages to find our booking but once she had found it was a bit more friendly. When we went to get into the lift we could not get it to move ,this was due to the fact that you needed to use your room card to get the lift working.Again we went to ask the receptionist how this worked and she again was a bit sharp !!! In fact a cleaner had to help us ??!!!. We reached our room and i have to say everything was very modern ,clean and the room and bathroom very big. The location is great right by the beach,and the hotel is clean with all the up to date facilities you need. I would definately recomend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable base.”
Reviews.Author: bargainchris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept for a few days prior to our cruise, when i first arrived It was late at night and the area looked run down, however hotel was very nice, and the room was clean and comfortable, we had breakfast at the hotel which was ok, not a lot of choice but was adequate. The hotel is within walking distance to a few shops and places to eat, and these are mainly frequented by the locals so the prices were pretty good. We visited the beach which took about 15 mins walking the beach was very nice and clean, we also went into the centre of Barcelona on the metro, the metro station was about an 8 minute walk and was only 5 stops into the centre of Barcelona (which we found very busy and crowded). If i was returning to Barcelona we would definately stay here again as you have the best of both worlds close to the beach and accessible to the city centre. the hotel had a rooftop pool (a small one) which my son enjoyed a small gym and free wifi, the staff were very pleasant and the room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sad experience”
Reviews.Author: Shobha R
Reviews.Content: 10 of us stayed here in Oct.2011 .Happy with room and breakfast 6 of us waiting in the lobby for 2 cabs which took like more than 1/2 an hour. I got up to ask about the delay of the cabs, my sister's handbag was gone with money ,passport, etc. She and all of us ran out of the hotel but of no help. The hotel staff did not do anything and behaved as if nothing happened. We did the usual police station, report. As the Embassies are closed on Saturday no passport could be obtained till Monday. My sister and her husband could not join the cruise without the passport. They extended their stay by another 2 days. The hotel, gave the rooms but at a much higher price, not at the rate we had booked for the earlier 2 days. It was really disappointing. Going to the police is also a farce and waste of time and effort. We felt unsafe even inside the hotel .I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good when booked in advance”
Reviews.Author: hecls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend treated me to a break away to Barcelona for my birthday. The hotel was really ideally located- 5 mins away from the station with an array of restaurants in the street behind. Room was spotless and very minimalist. Breakfast was included in the price of our room and was quite basic. But very clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eva P
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great breakfast, clean and spacious rooms. We recently held a training event at The Confortel and the Sales Coordinator Sheila was amazing! SOOOO accommodation! We met one of the owners and she was very nice. The food was amazing! Actually the presentation of our food during the event was beautiful!! I didn't realize that we were kinda far from the City and that would be my only complaint. The Ramblas just outside the front door was great. Very close walk to the sea. I would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: Close to metro, local rambla and the beach. A lot of value for money. Nice rooms, nice staff and very nice view of the city. We were very pleased with all aspects af our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - good location”
Reviews.Author: bennetbabe
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its price and location - we didn't want to pay the extra to stay in Central Barcelona and this hotel was very conveniently located to the Metro, just a few blocks walk away. We had a bed and breakfast package and was booked in advance on a very good deal! The rooms were surprisingly large for a city hotel and very comfortable with a good selection of toiletries. The staff were very welcoming and very helpful. The breakfast was lovely, with a large selection of cold meats, hot eggs, cheeses, breads, pastries, yogurts, juices etc etc. The rooftop pool is very small but does the job for a cooling dip and is definitely worth a trip up there for the amazing panoramic views of the city. My only very minor negative comment is the lack of bar facilities at the rooftop pool - it would have been lovely to have ended the day with a cold sangria admiring the beautiful views before getting ready to go out for the evening. But maybe in the height of the season this service is offered???? All in all, a very modern comfortable hotel but with little character.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: DublinExplorers
Reviews.Content: We decided on a last minute trip to Barcelona and booked this only a few hours before we flew out. We weren't expecting too much, as there wasn't much left online in the way of hotels, but we were plesantly surprised. The rooms are not plush or luxurious, but they meet requirements, are spacious and clean, you even get 4 free 250ml bottles of water in the fridge and a top-up of used ones, which I've never encountered before in a hotel. Wireless is available in the rooms, though while our iPhone could connect our Android couldn't, for some unknown reason. The wired PCs in the lobby are excruciatingly slow and quite unusable as a result. The hotel is a stone-throw away from the beach area, yet it is in a nice, quite residential area itself. The jewel in the crown for us, however, was the Rambla del Poblenou, the fabulous road near the hotel. The place comes alive at night with families out enjoying the great restaurants that line the road for blocks on end. We came back specifically to the road each of our three nights to eat there. The food is good, typical Catalan / Spanish food. You can sit outside, drink your vino, eat your tapas, savour your meal, watch the familes meet up and hear some lovely street musicians. The hotel is close to the Hop-on Hop-off bus tour stop, you can walk there in about ten minutes. It's also about a ten minute gentle stroll to the nearest metro. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. Their rooftop 'swimming pool' however is more of a dipping pool, so anyone planning on an energetic morning swim will be disappointed. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the beach, quiet”
Reviews.Author: BRLondon1001
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel 2 blocks from the beach in quiet, residential part of the city. Hotel is lovely though lacks facilities and atmosphere. I stayed in July so peak season and there was hardly a sole around so not the place to stay if you want a late night drink in the hotel bar. There is a lovely pedestrianised street 1 block to the north of the hotel which I only happened upon by accident as it was the opposite direction to the metro. Funky coffee shops, restaurants etc and a real commuity atmosphere. Also mad queues for some ice cream shop so it must be worth a visit! Room was spacious with very nice bathroom and nice big picture window looking out across the entire city and to the sea. I was on the 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS ONLY WORTHY OF 2 STARS”
Reviews.Author: SW61HS
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel which is mainly used by business people. The reception staff were generally unhelpful with one exception, a young woman, whose name escapes us, but we made sure we saw her with any queries we had. The internet the hotel boasts is an utter joke, it takes forever to connect. The day before we left it took us over an hour to check in online!!! We found this hotel very expensive for it's quality of service & amenities provided, it also boasts an extensive fitness gym which consists of a ONE weight training station & a couple of bikes!! I think that sums up what this hotel is all about - BAD VALUE FOR MONEY!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel - Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: stefarn
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel and rooms were clean. We arrived early after coming from our cruise ship but wasn't allowed to check in until after 14:00, so had to hang around for a few hours, we couldn't even use the pool area as we had no towels or card to access the lifts.. We had 3 beds in our room and all were portable beds which I thought was a bit poor for the standard of hotel that was advertised. No tea or coffee making facilities, but the free internet was good. Liked the location as it was only a 10 euro taxi ride to Las Ramblas. Plus the next block had its own ramblas with nice restaurants and cafes without the prices found in the main tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of reviews written by staff”
Reviews.Author: accident_tourist
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews on this hotel are obviously written by staff. Efficient and soul-less, the hotel rooms feature basic furniture that you would link it to a two star ibis rather than a four star that it purports to be. The swimming pool that is on the front of the hotel ad - and even at the reception - is a big joke. For a hotel with some 800 rooms, a 10 meter sq pond with a 20 sq m terrace (no exaggeration here) should never have been mentioned in the ad. Location of the hotel - off the center of town where you have attractions - cannot be satisactory to anyone other than those heading off to the beach. All said, you can find MUCH better value elsewhere in recession struck barcelona. Avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: aquaero
Reviews.Content: Very spacious, modern and clean rooms! Friendly staff. Nice breakfast. 5 min walk to Llacuna subway station (yellow line, which is connected to Barcelonata and Jaume station). 10 min walk to Bogatell beach and 5 min by taxi to the beach clubs. Next time we will book there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a family - location ideal for both visiting the city and still only 10mins walk to beach!”
Reviews.Author: timtrille
Reviews.Content: Located only 10 mins from metro and beach we will happily recommend this hotel whatever you want from your time in Barcelona. Only slight down side is the size off the roof top pool, but don't be put off as your only a ten min walk to a beautiful beach. Eat in the local restaurants they were all fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable confortel”
Reviews.Author: scona81
Reviews.Content: was a really nice place to stay, rooms were spacious enough, gym and pool area is basic but good. restaurant at night was very quiet but pizza was nice, buffet breakfast was quite good, and location is 5 min walk to beach and beach restaurant and bars. not too far from city centre either. walkable but most would prefer a short taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Booked Confortel Barcelona for a one night stay. The hotel was perfect for my requirments. Staff helpful and friendly and room was clean and spacious. All in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: gaytravel10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an excellent location in Barcelona. The location was good, about a 5 min walk to underground, and 15 min walk to the Bogatell Beach. Perfect for a holiday and getaway. I was excited that there was a pool on the rooftop overlooking the beach with a lovely view. Wifi access was good as well. Overall i would definately stay here next time. Beautiful hotel. Bathrooms were very nicely designed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: JLi73
Reviews.Content: We loved this design hotel close to the beach and a small rambla with bars and restaurants. The breakfast was good and the roof terrace a nice bonus. The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable and there is lots of room for clothes and toiletries. A small fridge with four bottles of water every day and free well-working wi-fi. It it a quiet part of the town, but we preferred to be close to the beach and travel into town (10 min by metro), instead of the opposite. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadtravelled09
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the location was good as the hotel is very near the metro so access to city centre is very easy. I would advise buying the daily or 2 day tickets for the metro as it works out cheaper and makes it easy to just hop on and off. We used the metro to access all the touristic sites we wanted to see and it turned out to be very easy and much cheaper than the touristic bus of the city. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and will explain about using the metro, where to get on and off and also have great detailed maps of the city behind the desk. The hotel is very modern but its very well done, the room is very stylish with a lot of storage. Good bed, tv and the bathroom is a good size with a shower and bath. Shower was a bit annoying as it kept slipping down to lowest level so my partner being over 6ft had a few issues with that. The room had a fridge which was stocked with free water which was a nice touch and necessary for summer in the city. The breakfast is buffet style and has something for everyone, a good start to the day. The pool was the only disappointment as it is tiny but the views from the roof top is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location 5 mins walk to beach ,30mins walk to city 5mins to metro”
Reviews.Author: Childminder1
Reviews.Content: Very good sized room for 3 people. Lovely area for restaurants away from city. Fantastic quiet air conditioning , really clean rooms, modern looking , staff always polite friendly . Brilliant location for combined beach and city holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Barcelona to get best of both worlds- beach and city!”
Reviews.Author: nicli-dw
Reviews.Content: We'd never been able to afford a 4* hotel before, and the only way we did this was by booking very early and staying in a cheaper area in Barcelona. I'm so glad that we did. This area is great- ok a bit rough from the metro to the hotel, but around the corner is a street full of really nice bars and restaurants. I assume most of the people there were locals as there didn't seem to be many hotels in this area. The food and drink was cheap and we had the best paella ever here! The breakfast at the hotel was expensive. But, around the corner was a nice patisseria where we bought pastries with different filling for breakfast. This cost less than 2euro. I've read in previous reviews that they we're given 6 bottles of water a day. Well, the recession must have hit as we only had 4. Worst parts of the hotel- the lifts were very unreliable and slow, with one out of two out of order for most of the stay. Another is that our room was not ready at the check in time. Eventually we were given a 'smoking room' but we didn't care ,we were shattered and needed a shower! The room didn't smell of smoking though, which was a relief. 10 minutes away was the most stunning beach ever. We walked along the front every day into town. This took an hour strolling or 90 minutes if you stop for a drink at one of the beach bars, as we did. Much nicer than catching a hot metro. We did catch it twice though, and it was fine. Trains come every 3-4 minutes and you needed to change twice to get to the 'Rambla'. But I'd say with the changes you could be on the 'Rambla' withing 30 minutes of leaving the hotel. We ate at the Port Olympic on the first night. The food was reasonable and the price ok. However we had a drink at a bar there and a pint and a wine was 16euro- compares to 7euro at Poblenou. Nice enough place bud we didn't go back. We went to see what the Rambla was like in the evening and my god, we went back to Poblenou. I have never seen so many people- it was like Wembley stadium had emptied onto the street! It was too crowded for us, but if you like the hustle and bustle, I'm sure u'd love it. Anyway, I'd come back to this hotel if i got another deal on it and will recommend it to other people. Bring your own toiletries though as you only get a cheap bar of soap, shower gel and shampoo. The swimming pool on the roof is tiny- more of a paddling pool but we didn't really make use of it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in Confortel”
Reviews.Author: electriclady80
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean Near beach and Metro Some rooms have balcony (not ours) but windows open up, which is nice Large rooms Free waters in mini refrigerator Wifi Cons: No wash clothes, only bath towel and HUGE hand towels (though I know in Europe washcloths are not really typical No conditioner or lotion samples, just shampoo Upon checking in we were told our room was not ready

Reviews.Title: “Not worth to pay the full price”
Reviews.Author: hmh72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august 2010 for 5 nights with our family. We got a very good deal with booking.com. This year you have to pay twice as much for the same room. Hotel is modern and stylish! Even standard rooms are big and the bed is a king size! The mattress is a little hard. Bathroom is also spacious. You get 6 very small water bottles every day for free, which is nice! We didn't like the staff. They don't show any hospitality. We had a problem with our room keys and had to go back and fort to the front desk, and they kept doing the same mistake at least 4 times. No apologies! This is very sad for a such a nice hotel other wise. We ate the breakfast every morning since it was included our deal. I wouldn't pay for it other wise. But it is above the average in Spain. Location is far away from the city. But is only 10 minute walk from the beach, which is nice! It costed around 20€ for 4 people to get to the hotel by taxi from Catalunia Plaza. Not bad! Subway(Lacuna/Yellow line L4) is about 400m away. Neighborhood is a bit weird full with wearhouses and car repair places. Wouldn't like to walk there alone at night. You can find some tapas places aroud the corner, but we went to the city every night.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: VikkiKevin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Confortel Barcelona for three nights while traveling around Europe on our honeymoon. We were excited to stay there as they were a four star hotel so we paid a little more than we were spending in other cities. Positives: The location is good. You are not downtown, but close to the beach, 10 minute walk from the mall and a transit ride (or longer walk) into the downtown. Negatives: The staff are just awful. When we checked in, there was a line of people waiting for help and the girl behind the desk just kept playing around with the phone and didn't even acknowledge anyone. When we finally checked in it was abrupt and not welcoming. We asked for a dinner suggestion and they directed us to the computers in the lobby. We called down asking them to make us a reservation at a restaurant we liked the sound of and they 'don't do that.' They don't look up when you approach the desk and are just overall rude. Not a nice feeling! I was really surprised to have this service in a four star hotel. We had had fantastic service from the other (B&B's and lower-starred hotels) places we had stayed. Room had a nice view, and free bottled water, but the shower was broken and one morning I didn't have hot water for the whole shower. We also saw some bugs, but it didn't bother us. Breakfast was fine, but overpriced (at 16 Euro per person). Pool area looked nice (we went up to see it but went to the beach instead). Overall, would not stay here again. I am sure there are better places to stay in the beautiful city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic base to see a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Danni6021
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my cousin for six nights at the end of September 2010. We were both very impressed by the hotel, it is very modern and spotlessly clean. The rooms are a good size, with plenty of storage, as was the bathroom which had a good hairdryer (ladies will know that this is very important!) We both felt there was plenty of choice at breakfast, all tastes and nationalities catered for, with "branded" food; Kelloggs, Nestle etc. There's also a little gym, pool (bit cold for me though) and the rooftop terrace is exactly what you want after a day's sightseeing, views over the city are beautiful. It's only a few tube stops to the city centre so I personally think you get the best of both worlds by staying here - close to the action AND a good night's sleep. I would recommend getting a Barcelona Travel Card, makes life so much easier and we must have saved a fortune in doing so. You also get discounts to some attractions too. The tube is a fantastic service, much cleaner and more to time than London I thought, the longest we had to wait was 3 minutes! I would recommend staying in a Confortel hotel and fell head over heels with Barcelona, hopefully you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nimu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of May. I had very high expectations of the hotel and was coming here looking forward to place that we could prepare ourselves for the next part of our holiday. First let me begin with the positives. The hotel rooms are very clean and spacious. They do provide you with either 4 or 6 complementary water bottles. They have free internet access that is quite fast, the cjeck--in process was quick with no problems at all. It has also easy and quick access to the beach. The downside of staying here is if you are in Barcelona as we were for the very first time, the hotel is really quite far away from the centre although the metro is about a 5 minutes walk away which was great - it is true based on the other reviews that it is very lonely and a walk alone can make one self-concience. Back the the hotel, the only anemities that one gets in the bathroom is a soap, shampoo and shower gel! Full stop! Not what I was expecting for a 4-Star Hotel. The other things to mention is that in the mini-bar there is nothing but the complimnetary water. For the food, should you decide to order room-service I placed an order for a hamburger. It came to me raw and col (it had not defrosted properly). I did ask them to come and replace it which they took away and re-cooked. They did not replace with a fresh one but only re-heated. The bed kept moving and we had tofigure out how to make it stable after various attempts. The breakfast we had only had one day and we thought was ok but over-priced. There are some restaurants and cafes that offered reasonable priced breakfasts outside the hotel that I would recommend that you try. All in the all, it was a very average hotel and I would not be really looking to stay there again were I to go to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quite and confort Hotel, For sure we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: WillyM
Reviews.Content: Very near to the "Rambla" and to the see shore. Clean, great breakfast, very friendly staff. Recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Clean & basic, website an over generous portrayal”
Reviews.Author: dmp1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 26th to 28th May 2011. Clean and basic. No tea and coffee making facilities, no complementary towels for use on the terrace and pool area. The tinned fruit and uninspiring range of food was not worth the €15 charged for breakfast. The location was ok, 10 minute walk to the yellow line tube. The hotel is in a similar league as a Holiday Inn Express with clean standard amenities, but at twice the price. Outside space was appreciated though small. We would normally opt for boutique properties and the review should be read with that caveat in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet location out of town but completely lacking in ambience”
Reviews.Author: Choc_eclaire
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet location East of Barcelona city near the beach (10 mins walk) then this may be for you. Not up to 4* standard and more a business than leisure hotel. Staff were very unfriendly, no atmosphere whatsoever. Rooms very clinical and whoever thought that castors for beds and chairs on laminate floor was a good idea - think again! If you lie on the bed resting on wall you get launched across the floor. Minimal toiletries provided (one very small soap, one shampoo and one shower gel), nothing but water in mini bar, although lots were provided. No corkscrew, no writing paper, no tissues, no robes or slippers, no area guide. The Ramblas Poblenou is just round corner and has some good restaurants/bars with street tables and shops. The area feels almost villagey despite the fact the gentrification is half complete and there are piles of rubble everywhere. Apparently tour of the nearby East Barcelona cemetry is worthwhile (sadly we did not have time to visit :-) ). Come back in 10 years and I reckon this will be a cracking area to stay in (and maybe the hotel staff will have attended the charm course by then too). Did not eat anything in hotel as it was so soulless. Metro is 5 mins away but when you first come out you do wonder what kind of area you are coming to as it is very run down.

Reviews.Title: “(Ahmad.B)Good hotel but with very few bad things..”
Reviews.Author: AhmadBarakat
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not in the middle of the city and thats an advantage because u can find cheap shops and restaurants around it. Metro station (llacuna) is about 5 minutes away if walking.. The hotel is clean.. Breakfast includes a good variety but not for people who dont eat pork like me so i didnt enjoy it. They give u 6 bottles of water for free daily.. Be careful because room cleaners suddenly open the rooms door without any notice.. That happened with me! There is no water cattle, no iron for the clothes, you have to pay for washing or ironong and thats very expensive.. The place there is quiet.. If i didnt have much money i would stay at it again, but if i did i will choose another hotel.. Hope u all enjoy :) The room doesnt contain iron, water cattle, tea, coffee,

Reviews.Title: “great location for every thing.”
Reviews.Author: lannie2
Reviews.Content: metro only 3 blocks away get a t10 ticket and use it as it says 10 times not just in 1 day.beach just 10 min away.hotel was very clean and staff helpful.food in the morning was good. it was also great to go back in the afternoon for a dip in the pool.hop on hop off great to see city .read up before you go about city to save time.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at a reasonable price. Very accessible”
Reviews.Author: wheeltravelerToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided one of the most spacious well designed rooms we have stayed in. The staff were helpful and friendly, the breakfast generous. The location is a little far from the city centre for walking, but by no means difficult to access. A plus for the location is that it is quiet and close to a lovely neighbourhood area with shops and restaurants and only a 5 minute walk to the beachfront. I have never stayed in a hotel so well designed for ease of wheelchair access. A third daybed fit easily into the double room.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: nofni
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the clear and promising website. It seemed reasonably priced for the amenities offered. However, when you arrive, you notice there is a little photographic trickery. The pool is tiny - too small to swim in, and both the rooftop area and gym are smaller than you would think. The hotel itself is in a fairly quiet area of town. The nearest metro stop is about a 5 minute walk away (yellow line) which is fine, but the area isn't the best lit at night so might not be advisable for some. The room is fairly spartan with a rather garish (to my taste) colour scheme. Amenities are functional at best. There is a mini bar ('free' water only but with a little room for bought items), but no kettle or iron. The bathroom is equally spartan, a few soaps and gels, and 2 of each size towel. No robes or any of the little travelling kits you sometimes see. The shower is powerful and the hot water hot. Everything was clean and working. The bed continues the rather basic layout. Rather than a double bed, my room had two singles pushed together. The beds were on wheels, and with the hard floor, made it seem a little like a hospital ward. However they were fairly comfortable and spare pillows were provided. Different types of which are available - which seems a little strange for a hotel that voluntarily provides so little of anything else. My main rub was that the horizontal soundproofing between rooms is poor. When lying in bed, you could hear the people in the next room speaking, and if they raised their voices at all (as my neighbours helpfully did a lot), even listen in. They were Germans by the way, and went to bed at 2am. I know this because that was the time I was kept up to till. Breakfast was perfunctory - the usual help yourself fare, and seemed replenished often enough. Plenty of free tables too, so no complaints here. I didn't try the restaurant but if you want generic overpriced Spanish food, there were plenty of places along the Ramblas one street along. In short, I'd say this hotel is along the same lines as a Holiday Inn or Travel Lodge, despite the impressive website, so compare accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Book it”
Reviews.Author: KATKEL
Reviews.Content: Hi Folk's After reading some of the feed back's I had my worries about staying here. I found the Reception staff very helpful and curtious.The Location is next to a mini Ramblers where there is plenty of Tappas- bars /// Spanish Restaurants. If you look at the Map it is as close to get to the open top bus stop as it is to the Metro, close to the Beach. The Hotel is modern / contempory / Stylish...... Would I stay here again. Yes, Yes Yes. But only because I like the real Spain...... If you have already booked it ( no worries ) if your looking for somewhere to stay..... BOOK IT. Any more info required just E-Mail me. Ian

Reviews.Title: “Good, new and clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yi0rg0s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the beach, around three kilometers from the Centre of Barcelona. Its a new and clean property, with its own parking (17euros per night!!!). The breakfast is good too.

Reviews.Title: “no way is this a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: draw69
Reviews.Content: the main problem with this hotel is the staff. They are rude and un helpful. At frist i thought it was because i was english but i heard the way they treated other people from ireland and france and they got no help from them as wel. The hotel location is ok for the beach but make sure you are not on the street after dark. The hotel is a poor 3star. No bar no room service after 10 pm and if they have a function they take all the lounge area and pool area away from you. Look around there are better cheeper hotels in barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, cannot fault it in anyway. Breakfast here is a must too”
Reviews.Author: Craigando
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Barcalona. It took me a long while to decide which hotel to choose, as I dont know Barca that well and was wary of the last time I visited there (albiet with a gang of lads) because my memories were of how seedy it was, especially at night, but may I say I chose really well with this hotel. Metro station (Llcuna, line 4) is 5 minute walk away, beach is a 10 minute walk away. There are shops and places to eat only 5 minutes walk away too. But the best thing for me was we felt safe there day or night. As for the hotel its self, the rooms were clean and large in size with 6 free bottle of water replaced each day, also has free wi-fi. I cannot stress enough how much you should book breakfast at this hotel, it is simply the best breakfast I have had in any hotel in any part of the world (including a 5 star Mayfair hotel) There was plenty of variety and it was all fresh and delicious. So in summary if you stay in Barcalona, you will do well to choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: revg88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived here for a large conference, 3 night before, and two nights after it finished, along with many colleagues. The room rates went up to over 270Euros per night. For that, we had no mini bar facilties (only water), the same breakfast every day, cockroaches and silverfish in our bathroom, and no airconditioning, plus a bed that rolled away from the wall if you sat up in it. Also no iron. The wi-fi is a joke. The breakfast was exactly the same everyday, and they would always runout of something and not replace it for maybe 20-30 minutes. The aircon was turned off because it was winter, but the rooms were quite stuffy, and if you had the window open you got the road and construction noise. When I showed them the cockroach, the two front office people just looked at other - no apology, no offer to change rooms, nothing at all. We could not get the bed fixed, so I put paper blocks under the wheels to stop them moving - however the cleaner removed them every day!! On our last day, I asked for a late checkout, 2 hours after the normal time. I was told it was an extra 20Euros - this was the last straw, especially remembering they were offering rates the day before for under 80euros, and we were still paying 270+. The CSO very ungraciously waived the fee only after I asked to talk to the absent manager. All in all, not a good experience - a 2.5 star hotel trying to be something it isnt. Things will go wrong, but it is always how people react to fixing it that matters, and these people didnt have a clue.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a second home. Very convenient. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Miamibeachmodel
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, including an organic food market within walking distance. Everything was well situated. Rooms are priced great. Free wifi in the rooms. Free drinks in the refrigerator...wow...great toiletries. Plenty of channels on tv. Best of all is the location. Within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownsuga
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel and i found it in a excellent area for getting around the Metro Station is a 5 minute walk away. The beach is a 10 minute walk away. I stayed in suite with a really comfortable bed, it had a little seating area and a lovely flat screen Tv which you could turn to either watching in bed or sitting on the lounge chairs, the bathroom was lovely with a nice shower and jacuzzi bath with a seperate toilet and bidet. There was loads of cupboard space and a fantastic easy to use safe. The room has a fridge which was stocked everyday with 6 free bottles of water which i found handy as there was no vending machine in the Hotel. The room had a great balcony with two sun loungers and a nice view of the Gaudi and also a view of the sea. I wasn't impressed with the Hotel breakfast which cost an extra 15 euro, so we only ate it once. The hotel also does not have a bar that you can sit at in the evening before you go out. We also found our room to be extremely hot but in February they turn off the aircon so you cannot use it. Also whilst in the room around 6 times our electricity would shut off and i had to get the maintenance guy to look at it, in which he flipped the trip switch and asked me if i had anything plugged in? this happened a further 5 times and was a big inconvience and not great if you cant even charge your phone. Saying that i think maybe there was a problem with that particular rooms electrics. All in all though i would say this hotel is great if you want easy access to toursit attractions and access to the beach within walking distance. .

Reviews.Title: “recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: vt1704
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights which was really good. The staffs are friendly and helpfu, good value for money, rooms are huge and nicely decorated which i like best. However, the area around is very quite which make us feel not very safe, the Llacuna metro is 6mins walk away and it takes just 5 mins to go to Barceloneta the main port of Barcelona and 10mins to city centre (Catalunya). Overall, this is a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Secure, clean and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Theos87 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Satisfying but it could be a bit better. It is little far from the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: acnz1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay in Barcelona. It is on quite a clean street and is easily accessible to tapas bars, restaurants and metro stations. There is also an amazing beach just down the road. The rooms were really modern, safe and tidy and extremely spacious. The bathroom was the size many hotel rooms are these days with a good pressure shower and large bath. There is also plenty of storage space in the room. The hotel facilities are good with a pool and free wireless internet. The breakfast was nice also with plenty of fresh fruit and sweet treats as well as the normal eggs etc. Definitely a hotel worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very clean and spacious- would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: LeahJosh
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the confortel, once you know where it is its very easy to get into central barcelona. Good service at reception, room and bathroom are large with big tv and free water. Pool was closed but the terrace and gym were still nice. Also beach was only a ten min walk away and Poble Nou was a nice street with many cafes for breakfast. Food in restaurant was tastey, but small portions and quite expensive. The downside was slow internet (although we were grateful for any free internet) and no tea making facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very comfortable and clean, in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: MJRCoKildare_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just spent Christmas in this hotel. Having booked for 5 nights with 100% cancellation fee and was one day late getting there due to adverse weather conditions was pleasantly surprised when the receptionist did not charge for the missed night. This hotel is excellent, very clean, lovely rooms cleaned daily. Breakfast is good but very repetitive, but there is a good choice of cold meats and fruit. Most of the nearby restaurants were closed over the Christmas period so having the breakfast in the hotel was a useful option. The hotel is in a very quiet area but it is walking distance from most main tourist attractions. I felt the bar prices were extremely over priced, almost ten euro for a Jack Daniels is exorbitant! There was nothing to do at night time in this area but this isn't a problem if you have spent all day sightseeing/walking and just want to relax at night. I would definitely return to this hotel but probably at a different time of year.

Reviews.Title: “very good but expensive and cold”
Reviews.Author: AGall0
Reviews.Content: very good business hotel but very expensive, in the middle of nowhere at least nothing around at night, not even a restaurant if not inside the hotel. hotel restaurant extremely cold, a/c too strong

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Joyluckclub336
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, modern and spacious. However it is not close to the old area of town. Beautiful view from the pool on the roof but it is like ice water. If you want to spend time at the beach this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Delusions of Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: review73186605
Reviews.Content: The Confortel Hotel is located in the Poble Nou district of Barcelona. This is an area in the former industrial part of the city which is presently undergoing a major re-development and renewal. Although much progress has been made since I first visited the region some years ago my impression is that it may be some time yet before the transformation is complete. The locals advised that it was still not safe to venture alone too far from the hotel after dark. The location is really good if you intend to use either buses or Metro Trains otherwise stay nearer the city centre. . On arrival we were issued with two electronic cards which allow access both to the elevator and the room. We immediately discovered that the cards would not operate the lift shaft but the porter kindly used his card to activate the machine. Mind you he didn't offer to assist with the luggage. Needless to say if the card wouldn't activate the elevator it wouldn't operate the room lock either. Back to the reception desk.! If at first you don't succeed... Ole! The replacment cards worked and we returned to our allocated room. Despite the fact that we had specified a non-smoking room both while booking the hotel and again on arrival, as we entered the heavy pungent smell of stale cheap tobacco smoke that greeted us at the door was quite sickening. Once again, back to the reception desk. We were immediately given fresh cards and made our way to a non-smoking room on an entirely "non-smoking floor" no less. The room was very basic and to be honest, quite grubby but it was late at night and we were exhausted and so any port in a storm. The price per night was an off season €109 for weekdays including breakfast (quite reasonable) but leapt to €202 for weekend nights. The hotel made much-ado about their free internet service but BROADBAND IT IS NOT and unless you've got lots of time and precious little to do, find an Internet cafe and save yourself a lot of bother.The hotel also boast a swimming pool but the glorified bath they are referring to would fail the Trade Descriptions Act on every count. The reception staff are very pleasant however and for the most part speak English. Breakfast is very basic. A word of warning if you opt to walk along the Ramblas. The Spanish love their dogs and keep dogs in great numbers. Despite signs threatening heavy fines for dog owners who do not clear up doggy deposits after their pets, many of the residents ignore the cautions so watch your step. If you enjoy a really good Pizza as you leave the hotel turn immediately right.. On the corner just down from the hotel opposite the Casino (NOT the Tapas Bar next to it) is the best Pizza House in Barcelona. This hotel is trying desperately to give an air of sophistication and has delusions of grandeur but it has a long way to go to reach the standards of some of the finer hotels I have experienced in other parts of Spain. It's trying to box well above it's weight but the promise of the well designed and spacious lobby area as you enter the hotel is not reflected in the rest of the building. Basically a glorified hostel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sakis13
Reviews.Content: with very polite staff,a huge room,with a huge bath! very close to metro station,almost 5-6 blocks away,and approx 15 mins to the centre of bcn! the zoo is in walking distance and there is also a market area 1 block away! it surely made my stay very comfy for a whole week!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, friendly neighbourhood with easy access to city centre.”
Reviews.Author: bailyhowth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night break in this hotel. Amazing deal with cityhotels.ie Hotel is located just off Rambla Poble Nou, which is a smaller quieter friendlier version of Las Ramblas. We go to city during the day and Po ble Nou in the evenings. Really enjoyed our break and not the first and certainly not the last time in this area and would definitely stay in this hotel again. It is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: monikamurer
Reviews.Content: We have our offices just next to the hotel but I would really recomend this hotel. The price is very good, the rooms are new and stylish, the sea is 5 minutes away and a lot of restaurants are near by. Also some small shopping possibilites you can find. For the city center you need a taxe. Service is good and the rooms are clean and nice. The service in the restaurant is not of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and well run beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSprx
Reviews.Content: Here you are four blocks from the beach. You are a 1 minute walk from the authentic Poble Nou where there are loads of bars, restaurants and shops. You are two blocks from the Metro which will have you in the city centre in about 10-15 minutes. The place is clean, well run and now provides free wifi. The connection isn't great but you get what you pay for. The pool has started closing at 1930h which is strange. Staff were very helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxieT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room for 3, it was a great size & beds were comfortable. Had a good breakfast every morning. Staff were very helpful. We loved the location! We walked to the beach (10 mins), used the pool (small but enough) & walked to the hop on hop off bus (10 mins). Would recommend it & stay again. We loved Barcelona. Rambla del Poblenou (turning right from hotel and 50 meters away) had everything you need; stores, restaurants, coffee & ice cream shops. Used the computers in the lobby, but they were slow.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable and modern.”
Reviews.Author: bethwjos
Reviews.Content: Would love to stay here again. Staff were very helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was superb. The bed was queen-sized and very comfortable. Well worth paying extra for the balcony room. Apparently the Dutch and Italian athletics team stayed here during the European athletics championships, shame we missed them. Would highly recommend the ice cream parlour around the corner and the cafe La Tertula for coffee/breakfast/lunch. Both are located on Rambla del Poblenou. (turning right from hotel and 50 meters away)

Reviews.Title: “a bit out of town but worth it”
Reviews.Author: jambo38
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying here for 4 nights, we had a room for 3 adult capacity and it was very spacious. We arrived on the bus from Girona airport and walked to the hotel from the bus station, this was a bit of a walk but gave a good impression of where we were located and how far from the main attractions. We were not disappointed with the hotel, very modern, yes plastic furniture such as the desk chairs but that was about as plastic as you got. The room had 3 good sized single beds, a fridge that was well stocked with water, and a really good sized bathroom, tv and a comfy leather style chair. The room was cleaned every day, as well we could not have asked for more really. Hotel staff at chcek in very good and spoke good english. We did not have the breakfast as we got our breakfast from the Spar shop at the "back" of the hotel and just popped it in the fridge. The location is away from the main tourist area but we liked that. There was a good lengthy street at the side of the hotel to the right and we ate there for 3 out of the 4 nights and a good 20 euros cheaper than the main port area which was about 20 minutes walk away. The hop on and off tour bus stopped about a 10 minute walk away and that was a great taxi style service to the main tourist areas. The beach near the hotel was very good and again away from the main areas. We had a 13 yr old with us and she said that she was happy that she was where we were staying so that she could savour the local atmosphere rather than the madness of somewhere like La Ramblas. All in all a good hotel, good area away from the crowds and we never had any disturbed nights at all, in fact we didnt really see the light of day until at 9.30am most days.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good and not very central”
Reviews.Author: lyso1
Reviews.Content: We were not that pleased with our stay because our room was located so we could hear the workers outside. The street opposite our window was very busy. We also found the furniture in our room very unconfortable, chairs for example was made of plastic stuff. The hotel is a bit offside. You have to do a lot of walking getting to nearest subway. The cleaning was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Euro Trip - Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Midi82
Reviews.Content: Very very nice!!! Room: stayed in Barcelona for 3 nights; we stayed in a doube/queen room and received the corner room on the 8th floor and room was by far the biggest of all the European hotels i've been too; both the room & bathroom was spacious, clean, comfortable and the air-con worked perfectly; having a corner room, we had awesome views spanning from the beach right around to the dome shaped hotel. Free wi-fi was also great. The room was perfect. Service: excellent; everyone spoke Eenglish and were very helpful. Food: the buffet breakfast was very good with good fresh food and plenty of choices; for convenience, it's worth including the breakfast as part of your stay Location: its a little further out from the centre but not too far out (say 20min bus ride to La Rambla); in a quiet neighborhood and there are a few restaurants near the hotel which are reasonable; there's also a supermarket close to the hotel which is convenient. The beach is a 5-10min walk; the closest train station is about a 5min walk Overall: Enjoyed the hotel as it was very comfortable and the service was excellent. You can't go wrong choosing this hotel! Tip: Buy tickets on one of the hop-on-hop-off tourist buses; we used the 'Touristic Barcelona' (purchased from the hotel); b/c of the size and hills of Barcelona, it is THE BEST WAY to explore this city as it takes you to all the major sights, whilst also seeing the streets of Barcelona and provides a radio-guided tour with individual headphones on the bus; i'm not usually a fan of these hop-on-hop-off buses but for those with limited time, its the best way and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: nesx87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was far greater than what i expected. The facilities are new, and give a sense of freshness and a holiday feeling. but the most important asset of this hotel is itsemployees who have been more than happy to help us with anything we asked for. Thank you for a good memory

Reviews.Title: “Great value, modern clean rooms and suberb breakfast”
Reviews.Author: filama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June 2010. Lovely hotel, very modern and clean. We stayed in a triple room which was a good size with a large bathroom. The buffet breakfast was definitely a highlight with lots of choice. Location was good - 5 minute walk to the metro which was only 5 stops away from city centre. Also walking distance to the beach although the nearest beach is popular with surfers so it can be quite windy! The hotel has a nice but small rooftop pool and sun loungers. Some of the reception staff were helpful with tourist information, some were not. The electronic key cards were a bit of a pain as they were required to operate the lift and didn't work very well but other than that we had no complaints and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “God value for money”
Reviews.Author: turistoStockholm
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel which is situated nearly beach ( 10 min by walk) and not far from the historical center ( 5 metro stations from "Poblenou"). There are a lot of restaurants and bars on Rambla del Poblenou. God breakfast in the hotel. Very god cleaning of the rooms. Helpful reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craiasazapezii
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, breakfast was very good, staff was friendly, great location (7 minutes walk from the beach and 6 minutes walk from the metro station).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel, but no bar.”
Reviews.Author: haze_ee
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, but location is a bit far from inner city. A bit rough neighbourhood if you wal the wrong direction. No bar and restautant closes early, although you can find some close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - couldn't ask for much better!”
Reviews.Author: samantha6235
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried at first after reading some reviews regarding the location of this hotel - personally we thought it was in the perfect location. A 5 minute stroll from the nearest metro (Llacuna), 10 minute stroll to the beach front (port olympic) and only a 10 minute journey or about 5 stops on the metro to the Ramblas. It was also about a half hour walk from the Sagrada Familia where you can actually see it from the hotel. We had a room on the 7th floor which had great views. There are a few good restaurants along the beach front but beward that they shut for siesta from around 5 - 8pm. This may be different in the summer. Staff were very helpful and spoke good english. The only minor set back was the shower lacked any power and the food wasn't amazing & a little overpriced. But there is so many places to eat outside the hotel you can't complain. I would definatley come back to this hotel, overall it was fantastic! P.s beware taxis from the airport! They say it's about €20 but when you actually get to the hotel they charged €35 as they charge extra for bags & so on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ecb489
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was awesome, the location not so great. it was very easy to get to the metro into the city but the walk to the metro was though a sketchy area, walking home at night was uncomfortable. There was a cute little walking area with some restaurants just to the right of the hotel and it is close to the beach. The restaurants were not delicious but they got the job done. The hotel restaurant was actually quite impressive. Nothing special but better than the other restaurants nearby. Very clean rooms though and the room was quite spacious. It was great for the price though!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: Quarrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last week and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again when visiting Barcelona. When booking the hotel, I was looking for somewhere central, modern and of good quality, but not too expensive. Finding the hotels in the centre a little too expensive, we decided to stick with the same quality of hotel, but look further out. There are varied reviews of the location of this hotel, but our personal experience was very positive. It's only 5 mins walk (via shops and cafes) to Poblenou metro station and within 10mins, you arrive in the heart of Barcelona. The line takes you either direct to the Barri Gotic (the Gothic Quarter, cathedral, close to the Ramblas) or to the Passeig de Gracia (Casa Batllo/La Pedrera/posh shopping street!) a little further on. A stop for the hop-on, hop-off bus is only 5 mins walk in the opposite direction from the hotel too. We found it to be quite busy during the day (locals rather than tourists) and it felt quite safe at night. Rather than venturing back into the centre in the evening, we ate at local restaurants. They did not have menus in English and we didn't encounter many people who could speak English either, so it's worth taking your phrase book if you don't speak or read Spanish very well. However, the people were friendly and helpful and the prices were much lower than places we had found in the centre during the day. We also found that the quality of the food was better, maybe due to the fact that their trade is with residents of the area rather than transient tourists. There's a good pizza restaurant (El Safareig?) on Carrer del Taulat (3mins from hotel) and a lovely cafe/restaurant (something like Cafe Blu?) on the corner of the same street and the Rambla de Poblenou. Our room was clean and spacious with incredibly comfortable beds. The bathroom was clean, although not particularly well-stocked as regards toiletries. The design is modern and just like in the official hotel photos, so not much comment needed there. It was exactly what we were looking for. Security is excellent, as the life requires the use of the room key. Breakfast was varied and well-stocked. There are computers in the reception area which are free to use, albeit frustratingly slow! The staff were very helpful, particularly the gentleman on reception at night. He helped us to get a taxi to and from the centre after midnight which cost approx 17 Euros (although that was to a club on the other side of Sants train station, so I assume that a taxi to the Ramblas would have been cheaper). Overall, I'd certainly recommend this hotel and will stay again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: iywv
Reviews.Content: As in other reviews, they had a very good breakfast every day and the free use of the Internet 24 hours a day was very convenient. It was also clean and the room decor was contemporary and I liked it very much. However, it was not very close to the center of the city and we had to walk more than 15 minutes to get anywhere. (You could take a train and the station is one and a half blocks away, but we opted to walk.) Although it was safe to walk even late at night, we may choose a different hotel that is a little more conveniently located next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, comfortable stay, ok location”
Reviews.Author: ptdog
Reviews.Content: Confortel hotel is located outside of Barcelona center; however, it's a short walk (10 minutes) to the nearest metro station. The location is business+residential and is very quiet. Some people may question the neighborhood because of its appearance and lack of people walking around, but I found it very safe. The room is average size with 2 single beds. It is very modern and very clean. I enjoyed the shower very much! Great water pressure! The room has free WIFI, or you can plug into the network jack for faster connection. Hotel restaurant food is average at best, but waiter was friendly. Overall, I enjoyed the stay very much. I highly recommend the hotel to people who prefer to stay away from the tourist areas and enjoy a short leisure walk before retiring for the night.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel bad smell in reception”
Reviews.Author: jgpe
Reviews.Content: first arrived at the hotel the reception had a really bad smell which we later noticed coming from the toilets in the basement worse smell ever down there. but you could not smell this smell anywhere else in the hotel. we looked at the pool on the rooftop which you couldnt use ta this time of year and i would be extremerly disappointed if this is the reason why i would of chosen this hotel in summer time, its around the same size of my bathtub and the area around it is nice either. we really liked our rooms though very nice and loads of room! mini fridge in room with free water and a free safe! the beds was acceptable too slept on alot worse! was about 15mins walk to la ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paulpark123
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the hotel for a new year break. The hotel is modern and very clean and the breakfast is good. As reported by others the hotel is out of the centre of Barcelona, but like others we did not find this a problem. It's a five minute walk from the nearest metro but because everything looks the same you can easily go the wrong way. The area is not threatening but just quiet. It was quite a relief to get away from the hustle and bustle of the La Rambla. A seven trip ticket for €7.70 on the metro was quite enough to get us round Barcelona in the three days we were there. The trip on the open top bus is a must. It cost €21.00 per person and was well worth it and you can catch it just a couple of blocks from the hotel, the Reception will give you directions. There are three routes you can go on but at this time of year the green line is not open. But the blue line and the red line were approx 2 to 2 and a half hours each trip. If you want to hop off at some of the attractions I think you need two days which costs €27 but if, like us, you just want to use the bus trip to see what attractions are worth going back to see in closer detail, you can then use the metro the next day. The Restaurants round the corner from the hotel are ok but not necessary the cheapest and we found a great restaurant near the Sagrada Familia - Els Porxos. Three course lunch including Sangria for €11.21. We followed the instructions on the hotel information about catching the train from the airport but found it was not a direct route and had to change but was still worth the €2.80. From the station, Estacio de Franca turn left then left again for the Metro, or ask a local like we did! On the whole it was a good choice for a New Year Break and the first few days were 18 degrees very different from our snowy return to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Location businessy, but hotel great”
Reviews.Author: tdeepti
Reviews.Content: Confortel Barcelona is a beautiful hotel, though the location is not the best. That being said its 100% value for money - maybe even more than 100%! The hotel is well designed, the rooms were spacious and very modern. Two things that may be a challenge are: 1) Heating: I think there wasnt heating - though the staff insisted there was (Made me think less of the staff) the end result was that we were very very cold (it was december after all) 2) Location: While it's reasonably close to the Llacuna metro station, the walk from the metro to the hotel is a little scary at night - since being a business district (it seemed), it was quite deserted Hotel recommended for its own worth, not for its location

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and fitted our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: sivan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and teenage son. The room was very nice and clean, quiet location, staff were helpful, easy access to the centre of town by metro, bakeries and a supermarket nearby. Appreciated the free use of internet in the lobby, as well as complimentary bottles of water put in the room's fridge each day. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: mandyjackson
Reviews.Content: The Confortel was well-worth the money (and, at a discounted price, it really was well-worth it) paid. Staff were ever-polite, helpful and kindly. The rooms were spotless and kept that way, the services offered were excellent (apart from the ironing service which seemed over-priced at 5 Euro a shirt...) e.g. free internet service, gym with the hotel overall being of a stylish cut. Some people have mentioned the distance as a problem and it is only if walking for 5 minutes is such a problem for two metro stations are within 5-10 minutes walking distance and, to be honest, it's much better to (only) just be outside the main hustle and bustle of the city just to relax. I found the location to be great - safe area and with a pedestrian zone literally around the corner with many-a-shop to service your needs. The beach was one straight walk 5 minutes away, or less even, and you can find yourself from there walking to what appears to be the business district. If you wish to place the hotel on a mind map, La Sagrada Familia is within eyesight of the hotel so that's also within an accepted walking distance. Overall, it was a comfortable and pleasant experience to stay in this hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but a little away from the center”
Reviews.Author: publius358
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay at this hotel via NCL for our cruise that departed the next day. It's a little distant from the airport, but after almost 24-hours of flying, it was a welcome respite. the desk staff was very helpful, friendly, and multilingual. When we arrived, we were zoned out. However after a quick nap, we were ready to get dinner and do a little walking of the surround area. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. For some reason when we checked in, we did not receive the welcome and transfer instructions letter from NCL. When we explained this to the staff, they were understanding and were able to provide the info and ensured that we were not left behind when the bus transfer arrived the next morning. The desk staff also recommended restaurants to visit (aside from their house restaurant!). Valet/bellhop service was pretty decent as well. The hotel is not too far from the sea and the Parc Poblenou and the el Poblenou district. The breakfast buffet was truly grande and European. Lot's of variety, cold and hot, pastries and meats. Included in the room fee. Wi-fi and wired internet service in the guest rooms was not free. However, they did have a business center that was free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: page1256
Reviews.Content: About 45minutes to walk into Barcelona city centre. Underground near by, also buses. Trouble is if you want a late night out you'll need a taxi if you don't fancy the walk. Nearest tour bus stop is about 15minute walk away. Area around the hotel is a bit rough, but seams to be progressing, but very slowly. Maybe in 5-10years the area maybe better. Very quiet though, if you don't want the noise. Free Internet very good in hotel, but i recommend that you take your own laptop, as the computers in the hotel are all in Spanish writting, including the keyboard setup. Excellent restaurant, if you don't mind pizza and pasta or burgers. Staff can be friendly and helpful, as long as you get the right member of staff. Some staff seam to have little knowledge of Barcelona, when we asked how to get somewhere, they didn't seam to know. The bed in our room has wheels on it, so if you tried to sit up to read a book or watch the very limited TV, you'll row down the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nic-la17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break and was very pleased with the hotel. Great location just off the beach and nice walk along to Port Olympic, about 25 minutes. Right next to the Metro and accessible for all major sights. Modern hotel with lovely rooms and huge bed!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: doaaa76
Reviews.Content: I loved the breakfast buffet and that Internet is availabe wirelessly 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KayJazz
Reviews.Content: Just like the many others, we too used this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and for our pre-cruise hotel. Everything about the hotel from location, service, room/bath size is true. We took the Aeropuerto bus from the airport to city center/De Catalunya - 5 EURO each. Then took the Metro from De Catalunya, made one transfer and got off at the Lucuna Metro stop -approx 2 1/2 blocks from Metro to the hotel. If you angel slightly left when you exit the Metro this is the shortest walk. Each Metro tkt 1.35 EURO, or you can purchase a T10 Metro pass for 10 EURO good for 10 Metro uses (ticket can be shared with those traveling in your party - this was our choice). While the Metro had steps to contend with and the transfer station had various steps, we managed OK. I would suggest this if you have easy/little luggage to carry or like an adventure like we do. The taxi from the hotel to the pier was 15 EURO, however, with the luggage and pier add-ons we paid 23 EURO's total. We made have paid more since the hotel had to call for a taxi, thus some EURO's already on the meter... FYI - from the pier to the airport the taxi with luggage/port surchages cost 37 EURO, plus tip. The residential area had plenty of restaurants and little shops and we ate our meals outside of the hotel - better value. Ate at "SunDowner" for breakfast and was able to get 2 for the price of 1 at the hotel (8.55 EURO for and hotel is 14.99 EURO p.p.) Cuian Mediterranean restaurant at corner of Publonou and ? for approx 23 EURO for a bottle of wine, mussells and Cod in Almond sauce - fabulous! Some fellow cruisers ate at Rawand (sp) restaurant and said great food/value. The Confortel Barcelona is located about 2-3 blocks from the 'Torre Agbar' building which looks like a bullet from the distance. Free use of internet and minibar water a great bonus. Overall a safe nieghborhood. What we liked best about being ithis residentail area was safety and not all the noise from city center/Las Rambla's hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel close to the beach metro and local shops”
Reviews.Author: kirstysbooth
