Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Fiance on a 5 day break. I chose the hotel after reading reviews on here (as I always do). The hotel is situated within a minutes walk of a long stretch of local shops bars and restaurants, about 5 minutes walk to the beach and 5 minutes to the closest metro stop which will take you into the heart of the city for little more than a euro. Its in a quiet neighbourhood as well so no noise in the evenings and it was perfectly safe to walk along the beach and the main street even late at night. We liked the location as its not a very touristy area so you can experience true spanish culture, but you are also only a short metro journey away from all the sights of the city. The hotel itself is clean and very modern, our room was 510 and overlooked the city, with the beach to the left and various famous landmarks to the right, so we had the best of both worlds. The room was spotless and cleaned daily. I particularly liked the 6 complimentary bottles of mineral water we received daily and the fridge we got to store them in. Which is also big enough to store other drinks and snacks. The bed was on wheels so no good if you like to sit up and read a book etc but was big and very comfortable. On the first night we had a drink in the lobby which was okay but it would have been nice to actually have a bar to sit in rather than out in the lobby. We logged onto the Wi-Fi since we have a laptop with us and although the signal is weaker in the rooms and not very fast it works well enough for you to send a few emails etc without too many problems. The roof terrace was good though we only dipped our feet in the 'pool' (its pretty tiny but okay for a paddle to cool off) its a pretty good suntrap as well up there. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel since it was 14 euros each, instead we would nip around the corner to the local patisserie for croissants and then eat them on the beach. All in all not a bad hotel at all, it was certainly clean and comfortable but nothing spectacular. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: hedfan1
Reviews.Content: Everything that you would expect from a city centre hotel. Good sized clean rooms, excellent breakfast a safe and professional atmosphere throughout. Great value for money and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: HBurger82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on the 6th floor - the room was confortable, modern and clean, daily housekeeping was very efficient and we could just about see the sea from our window. The free water in the fridge in the room was great, using the fridge to keep beer cold was better! The bed was huge and comfy but was on wheels so kept moving across the room when we sat up in bed watching TV! The breakfast was brilliant, cereals, hams, fruit, pastries, muffins, cakes, bacon, eggs, sausages, tortilla... too much to choose from! There were just a couple of drawbacks to the hotel - the advertised swimming pool is little more than 8ft by 8ft, and 3ft deep - it's really not big enough to swim in, but is it quite nice to cool off after sun bathing. Secondly, after 5 days we did get a bit sick of getting the metro in and out of the centre each day, but I'm sure this wouldn't be a problem if you were just staying a few days. Lastly we had to wait about 15mins to check in, there wasn't a queue, just one guy in font of us asking ALOT of questions but no sign of the single staff member getting anyone else to help out. Overall though we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for cruise stopover”
Reviews.Author: travellerdave2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Confortel Barcelona for one night prior to departing on a Western Mediterreanean cruise September 18th. Barcelona is becoming one of the fastest developing large cities in Europe and is recognized as a major cruise ship port. This hotel was our choice for a layover based mostly on the price (55 Euros) for a one night stay with a standard queen size room. The hotel is situated east of the city centre about two blocks from the beach in a developing area consisting of mainly older apartment high rises and a block from Rambla de Poblenou. The hotel is very modern and unusual in decor. The rooms are very comfortable with sparse furniture and a spacious bathroom offering a glassed in shower and separate toilet area. The room is bright with a fridge full of free bottled water and small LCD TV featuring many Spanish channels and English channels as well. You must use your room card to activate the elevator and room lighting/airconditioner so make sure you get two cards from the desk. The desk staff were friendly, however, not too helpful for directions. Since we arrived early they stored our suitcases in a secured area until the room was ready after 3:00PM. We did not use the restaurant in the lobby instead elected to walk a block east of the hotel to a nice commercial street with many restaurants and shops. Since the location was away from the tourist area the locals use this area for shopping and dinning. We found the food to be above average and service excellent in this area, well worth a visit especially in the evening when the area comes alive. There is a small pool and sun deck area on the roof, however, it is small and crowed in the evening. Everything is in walking distance including the double decker tourist bus that covers the entire city on the green line where you can change over to the blue line and red line at selected stops. You catch the bus next to McDonalds at the beach area. One or two day passes are available at a reasonable fee. Headphones are used on the bus with several languages offered during the tour. This is a great way to see the city on an open air double decker which allows you to get off at any stop and get back on once you have toured the particular area. Smart concept here. TIP: Make sure you print off the address of this hotel to give to your taxi driver prior to leaving the airport as this hotel appears to be not that well known. The cost from the airport is typically 30 Euros plus tip. The cost to the port for the cruise ships was 15 Euros. We found the taxi drivers spoke almost no english and were blunt. Considering the price and amenities this hotel is a winner. I would estimate that within 2-3 years the area will be re-built making the Rambla de Poblenou a major tourist centre. Would stay there again. If you wish any further information please feel free to email me [--].

Reviews.Title: “FANTANTIC STAY VERY NICE HOTEL NEAR THE SEA AND TOWN CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: konsara
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for seven days, from 8TH to 14en August!!!First of all,the hotel is near the metro station named Liacuna and it is about 100 meters far away from the sea.The whole staff was really friendly ,answering to all questions.At this hotel,we enjoyed the rich buffet breakfast,with delicious cakes, the spacious and the mondern renavated room of the 7th floor with nice view to the sea and to the Sagratha Familla and the small swimming pool on the 8th floor.Also,in the friedge they had small bottles of water,which were free, like the internet access near the reception .Finally the room service was very nice, you have the opportunity to choose with no charge to clean your room every day. We cannot find something that dissapointed us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AmyJoLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in Barcelona for 2 days before going on elsewhere in Spain, we chose this hotel and got a really good rate! Now if your not comfortable with being a bit further out of town and having to walk a little (5 mins from the Metro) then this maybe not the place for you as it wasnt direct to find, infact if it hadnt been for the big lit up Confortel on the front of it i imagine we'd have gotten a little bit lost! The area around the hotel is also still under development and if your a lone female id recommend somewhere a little more populated. I think once the area is develped it will be great! HOWEVER the hotel is fantastic the staff were always really really friendly and helpful and although we were put into a smoking room you wouldnot have known! The rooms are lovely and modern and have really lovely comfy beds! The aircon is also amazing with the heat! There is a lovely pool on the top of the hotel and the hotel is a three minute walk to the beach! The hotel is also just around the corner from a fantastic road full of local spanish restaurants and cafe's and a lovely patissery is on the corner of the hotels road! You can also walk along the beach front from the hotel to the olympic port and further on but Bewarned when its 29Celcius take water and be prepared to stop a lot! I'd recommend this hotel is your ok with being further out of town and dont mind walking a bit from the Metro. We will definately think of coming back here again but may also look elsewhere! It was definately value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Minimal and affordable luxury"”
Reviews.Author: Spyrilio
Reviews.Content: Nice price, excellent breakfast, 10 minutes from center of Barcelona by metro, minimal design, willing reception guys, but the sheets in the room have been changing every third day"

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious and good location”
Reviews.Author: Wee_monsieur
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that we got this stay for a lot cheaper than another hotel (we needed an extra night) and found it much better. A bit away from the city centre, but the public transport system is excellent and very cheap. There are some nice restaurants nearby in a lovely tree-lined boulevard, with chamfered corners (I had to look that one up!). Well worth seeking out and using as a base for city / beach/ sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Perfect compromise of location and price”
Reviews.Author: lfabia1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with friends. Hotel and rooms were of a high standard, very spacious and free botteled water in the rooms which is nice. The pool is a lot smaller than the pictures on website and so is the area around it, got very busy in afternoons and not always enough sunbeds for everyone. It was about 5 min walk to beach, 15 min walk to port olympic and to get to town there is a metro which is about 5-10 min walk (and then 5 stops to las ramblas). For the price we paid (£65 a room on last minute) I thought this was excelent value, at this time of year it was too hot so was very thankful of the pool, i don't think there are many other hotels of this price range in barcelona with a pool, and it was no trouble being a bit further out, it was nice to be nearer port olympic as I prefer the restaurants and bars round there in the evenings. Overall I would definately choose this hotel if I went back to barcelona. also had computers with free internet use so this meant we could check in online for our flight which was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: mortenab
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this nice hotel. Good breakfast, close to beach, have some restaurants around the corner and not far from the metro. Only minus was the minibar which is free, but only contains 6 bottles of water. This is a 4 star hotel, but have no vending machines or didnt get in contact with roomservice. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. :) Strange that this hotel is at index 148 of 598 hotel when writing this. Should be in top 50.

Reviews.Title: “amazing trip, a must see city, great location hotel.”
Reviews.Author: armaghpaula
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights the end of July start of august with 2 friends. The location is brilliant 5 minutes walk to the beach and a couple of metro stops to the centre. The hotel was very clean, spacious rooms and excellent air conditioning and very secure you need to activate your room key in the lift to get to your room. Mini bar stocked with free Water every time you let the maid in. The breakfast buffet was tasty and there are plenty choices. The staff was always helpful and couldn’t do enough for you. There is great views from the roof top pool of the beach and local area, although small we never had to wait long for a bed. The local Rambla de Poblenou is very charming and quaint. The area is not touristy at all which we felt was a plus as we traveling to see the country and mix with the locals. There are lots of nice restaurants and little shops in this area. We traveled with the lonely planets book on Barcelona its great for everything you need in Barcelona. This was our second time in Barcelona we were there in February, and we have tried a lot of the restaurants and bars etc in the book. We went to the following restaurants and would highly recommend. Taxidermista, Placa Reial great staff and lovely area we had a great experience both times. We had the tapas for starters 4 dishes, then the paella we had great wine also. Orio, ferran 38 this was were we had pinchos, small portions of bread with different toppings, Amazing. You just keep your cocktail sticks and at the end they count them and you pay per cocktail stick. Also great wine. La Vinga del Senyor, Placa Santa Maria, this place was amazing they have over 300 bottles of wine, and the staff have good knowledge we had the tapas with the wine. We had to wait on a table but well worth it. Lovely area also just in front of a church

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in residential location”
Reviews.Author: Tuire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in June/July turn of the month. Very convenient hotel with clean, spacious rooms and excellent air conditioning. The breakfast buffet was tasty and there are plenty choices. LOCATION The local Rambla de Poblenou is charming. The area is not touristy which I think is a big plus as you are traveling to see the country and not other tourists. There are lots of nice restaurants and little shops. The hotel is very good option especially for the beach but the access to centre is also quick with either bus or metro. TRANSPORTATION: Tip: Rather use the Poblenou metro station as the walk to there is more pleasant through Rambla de Poblenou or Carrier de Maria Aguilo. We used 4 day travel card that costs 19,50. See other options: http://www.tmb.cat/en_US/barcelona/moute/targetes/targetes.jsp. Both the metro train and buses are air conditioned, but the metro stations and tunnels are rather hot so maybe we would have been using more the buses if we'd understood that earlier. SHOPPING: The nearest Spar food store is in the same block in the Rambla corner of Doctor Trueta street and a Mercadona supermarket you can find when you turn left on the Rambla and walk three blocks. It is on the lefthand side on the Rambla corner. The nearest big shopping centre is Glories in the Avinguda Diagonal. You walk there in 15 minutes. DINING: We ate couple of times in the local restaurant Cala Blanca at Doctor Trueta side of the block (calablanca-bcn.es). The food was very fresh, tasty, reasonably priced and the portions are decent. Especially the lunch menu is very good deal. They also provide their menu in english.

Reviews.Title: “True city experience, away from Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: LosTigres
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. Third trip to Barcelona and I think my favorite location. Convieniently linked to bus routes and metro. Nearest bus stop to city centre 3mins, nearest metro 10. Hotel was very modern, beds were comfortable- a big plus. Mini bar stocked with free!! water. Wifi was a weak signal. Loved the location net door to La rambla Poble Nou. Beach, bars and resturants. Pool on roof very panoramic. Room rate was excellent, did not include breakfast- no problem though plenty inexpensive coffee shops nearby. Bus map- very handy avaliable at the tube station, ask for one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic area, close to beach and walking distance to Olympic Port”
Reviews.Author: ah2009
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I would say that despite any slight reservations about the hotel itself, I felt that the area and location more than made up for it. The hotel lies just off a loveIy tree-lined avenue where there are plenty of tapas bars open til late. It is also a 5 min walk to the beach and a 10 min walk to the Olympic Port. The metro stop is a couples of minutes walk away but we found we could walk to the zoo and Sagrada Familia within 20-30 mins. In my opinion, the hotel caters mainly for corporate travel. The rooms are large, very clean and comfortable and the decor is modern but not very warm. Although free wifi is available, the signal is very weak and was barely usable. The hotel does not offer room service but there is a pizza menu provided by reception should you wish to order. The mini bar is free but only contains water. The swimming pool on the roof is adequate but perhaps not as good as some others we have experienced in Barcelona. All in all, a great stay in a great location just outside of the city centre. As I said, despite my slight reservations, I would recommend this hotel & location to anyone wishing to travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RobMo
Reviews.Content: After searching quite extensively for a hotel for a weekend in Barcelona we eventually settled on this one. We couldn't afford a nice hotel in the city centre so decided we'd stay a little out from it and have a nicer place to stay for our money and we really were not dissappointed at all. The location of the hotel is great - the area itself is going through some regeneration so yes, there are a few cranes about and the odd building work but this was easily made up for by the lovely street at the back of the hotel. There were several tapas bars and restaurants all serving great (REALLY great!) food and drink and packed full of locals. The staff were very accommodating to us and our total lack of Spanish vocabulary and all the places we went to in the vicinity of the hotel were amazing value for money. On the last night, 4 of us gorged ourselves on tapas and drinks and the total bill was still under €60. Even with the £ so weak against the € at the moment that's a good price for us Brits! The hotel is also located only 5 minutes walk from the beach and you can walk to the Port Olimpic in 25 minutes along the seafront (very pleasant indeed). There is also a Metro station only a few blocks away which then is 5-10 minutes to get right into the centre at Place Catalunya, Las Ramplas or Barceloneta. A taxi from the airport to the hotel was about €30 and a taxi from the hotel to the centre of the city was €5-10 depending on where you were going. The hotel itself is very nicely done out, if perhaps a little on the cheap side (think Ikea showroom). We paid about £75 per room per night including breakfast (having got a really great rate through the price comparison on this website) which was EXCELLENT value. The buffet breakfast had a great selection, there was always plenty of space to sit and the fruit was some of the tastiest and freshest I have had anywhere in the world. The rooms were again nicely decorated, very clean and with a great shower but still a little cheap compared to what you would usually expect from a 4 or 5* hotel. As I say, still excellent value though. Pool on the roof was lovely with great views of the city. Staff were a little 'short' on occasion but generally very friendly. The only complaint I would have is the on-going argument I had to have every morning at breakfast to explain to the staff that yes, breakfast was included in my rate only for them to insist it wasn't and my then having to go to reception, have them agree it should be included and the staff in the restaurant to acknowledge this. To do this once would perhaps understandable but every day became a little tiresome... Overall though, I would definitely reccomend this hotel and will probably go back again, for the atmosphere in the streets around the hotel if nothing else!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Confortel - Clean, Cheap, Spacious Rooms and Pleasant Staff BEWARE OF LAUNDRY SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: lucypaine
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Barcelona with my partner and young son- nearly 3. We got off at the airport and had to get a taxi to the hotel. The taxi's are on the same side of the road you get off and there is a system for getting the taxi and we had eventually found the end of a huge queue for the taxi. The systems is great though and the queue moved quickly.. The cost to the hotel (print off the full address - The Street address is pretty useful Roman Turro and if you mention La Ramblas Poblo Nou also near Llacunna. It cost 26euro. (30 euro on the way back. The taxi drivers were all really kind and helpful to us and especially kind to my son - helping with the pram and adjusting the seats, seat belts and even providng chid seats sometimes. We arrived early adn the staff let us continue to our room. It is large, clean and spacious. not much of a view but you can see the city or beach not far away. There is a slight smell - hardly noticable - of drainiage around most of the city at times. The beach is a good 10 minutes walk away just behind hte hotel and you can walk to Port Olympic in about 10 minutes where there are many restaurants. We found that teh best place to eat was Flaherty's Irish Pub just off La Ramblas (2nd right on a little square) where sunday dinner is 9euros and there is a happy hour mon - fri. Its great vaule and a good feed. We found the food difficult after a few days and longed proper vegetables, etc. and this was great and cheap with good music, sport and food all rolled in. The Oriental restaurant on La Ramblas served me a spider in my nooodles on one occasion and on another we asked for 2 beer in Casa Joan and it cost 18 euro!!! If you have young children it is best to get a taxi from the hotel as the metro / tube has lots of stairs and is no equiped we found to deal with buggys' etc and little legs! about 10euro will take you to the Colon and bottom of La Ramblas. A taxi back can be got just across from the Colon. The city is gorgeous, it is really expensive, be careful where you eat on the main routes. Go to the Zoo - straight up to the left from the Colon it is about 17euro for an adult and see the dolphin show which is great. Most important bring your walking shoes... I would not recommend a holiday to Barcelona for young children because of all the walking etc, but the hotel itself is lovely, clean and very very respectable. I did not however eat in it. DO NOT GET YOUR LAUNDRY DONE HERE - I GOT AN INCORRECT BILL FOR 122 EURO FOR A FEW CHILDRENS T.SHITS A DRESS AND A SKIRT + 3 PAIRS OF CHILDREN'S PANTS AND A PAIR OF BOXER SHORTS!! Nice small pool and sun deck. Worth the money, however, not really child friendly spot. The little restaurant at the end has lovely staff hwoever, and they love children. My son got a different icecream every night in either an elephant or cow, pig etc adn they were very friendly as was everyone we met in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with problematic location and service”
Reviews.Author: LLGIsrael
Reviews.Content: I've picked this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and reserved way ahead of my arrival. Upon arrival I found out that there is some major construction work around the hotel, making it imposibble to reach the hotel according to all GPS instructions. After spending too much time driving around and trying to find my way to the hotel, I eventually parked my car and went to find the hotel. The reception clerk said they were aware of this and told right away which address to load onto the GPS. He was extremley surprised with my dissatisfaction. He seemed not to understand why the hotel should have informed, at leasat its foreign guests. The hotel surroundings are not a place to take an evening stroll: full of abandodned and under-construction buildings and heavy sewage smell. After I had parked my car in the underground hotel parking, I was told that I would be charged for it 20 Euro per day, even though the hotel failed to mention this during the reservation or during the process of my arrival. Two days after I payed for the parking, they asked me to pay again - it took me a while to convince them that I had already payed. When I tried to order a taxi through the reception desk, one day in advance, I had to repeat my request three times, each time to another clerk - since, as every single one of them stated himself "It's good you've mentioned this, because the clerk who was here earlier forgot to write it down". The hotel itself is modern, clean, serves decent breakfast and offers spacious rooms, but the service is basic at-best, and what is more troubling: the staff is not aware of its malfunctions. They seem to think you shuld take care of yourself, repeating every request and demanding to know everything.

Reviews.Author: LLGIsrael

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: me550
Reviews.Content: First drawback being that they didn't have my booking. I'd made it the day before on their official website. I called soon after to confirm and was assured (bluntly) that it was too early to be displayed on their system. So I thought never mind and took a chance. I arrived the next day and they had nothing. They assumed Id booked on some unofficial travel agent website, when I told them it was their official site that I made the booking I just got some blank stares. Fortuntately it wasn't full and I got a room. The hotel is nice, very good value, nice local neighbourhood close to the beach and about 10euros taxi from the city centre. Free internet access in the lobby. The room was large, spacious and minamlist. Not very cosy, as others have said, but you make it your own after a few days and it bothers you less. The hotel is a smile-free zone. The staff are always helpful but always blunt and charmless aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Super Awesome but little out of the Main City”
Reviews.Author: sups1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Confortel in September. It was an awesome hotel and the rates were very competitive. We booked a suite for ourselves. The room size was huge with a balcony. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi as well as a shower cubicle. It has been one of the neatest hotel I have ever stayed at. There was free internet in the lobby. It has a very modern deisgn. A modern establishment with designer rooms equipped with technological facilities, your stay here will be a comfortable, be it for business or pleasure. The walk to the beach can be a little longer than you expect. The swimming pool is on the rooftop. Unfortunately we could not use it because of the weather but again very neat. The rooms were large and the bed was very comfortable. They even have a pizza delivery service!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern decor - this hotel has a real personality”
Reviews.Author: webstercruisers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel prior to our cruise. The rooms were extremely clean and quiet. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. The roof top pool area has a great view of Barcelona. The only negative I can think of is the breakfast. Our package included breakfast and even though it was free- it was not worth it! The food was very strange and not extremely fresh. The coffee and juice were good, but the food was awful. I would highly recommend this hotel - just eat breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find”
Reviews.Author: guitar78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Confortel Barcelona in September 2008 and throroughly enjoyed our stay. We were welcomed with chilled fresh orange juice and friendly English speaking staff. Yes, the hotel is not in the centre of town, however the metro is a short 5 minute walk away. We liked not being in the bustling centre, the beach is literally 5 minutes away- and what a beautiful beach it is!! Nothing could have been made any better, the rooms are big and comfortable, the food in the evening was absolutely delicious! We chose to eat in tthe restaurant two nights, as at 16 euros, we felt the standard was first class. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “clean but not homley/cosy. felt like staying in a modern office block.”
Reviews.Author: wesleymon
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is unsuitable for anyone travelling to Barcelona for purely sight seeing. this is kind of business/conference hotel. It looks like built from IKEA flat pack - very boring deor - most walls are laminate of contrasting colours. our room looked like board room with a bed in middle (the bed itself was bot bad though). There was some fault with the TV ( loose contact i suppose) and had to push/pull the wires before we could watch TV. The room and toilet were clean. Did not hear any noise from outside, although there is some serious building work taking place right opposite. A breakfast at the hotel restaurent costs 15 euros and was worth maybe 6-7 euros(thats rip -off). Llacuna is the nearest metro station and its kind of 8 mins walk from hotel, it takes about 12 mins on the metro to La Rambles (with 1 change). So to sum up, I wouldn't say the hotel is very bad but its definetely not cosy and the location is not good, its out of way for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaNTrondheim
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent christmas at this hotel this year. The hotel is fantastic! great service and the staff speaks good english. Our room was cleaned very well each day, and they also had free internetaccess in the room, witch is important to us when we travel. The only bad thing was that the breakfast was not included, and it costs 15 euro each day, but that is something the travel agent should have told us about. I myself work at a hotel and have quite high standards, atleast when it comes to good service, and this hotel lived up to all my expectations. They made our christmas the most memorable yet :) Higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not cosy...”
Reviews.Author: BenganJ
Reviews.Content: Nice "designer" hotel. Everything work fine. Good breakfast with lots to choose from (although a little to much cakes, etc. for my taste). As with most "designer" hotels, design goes before easy of use or from being cosy. The bathroom was in red colors and you also got a red soap but there wasn't any place to put the soap so it fell down into the sink all time - not a big problem. Free minibar with two bottles (25 cl) of still and two bottles of sparkling water, two juice bottles, one coke and one coke light, one beer and one non-alcohol beer. Neighborhood doesn't look very nice, a lot of buildings being demolished around the hotel but just 100 m from the hotel is a nice little "walking street" with restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “By the beach”
Reviews.Author: NZ_abroad
Reviews.Content: Big minimalistic rooms. Only a few minutes from the wonderful beach front even although we couldn't see the beach from our room. The metro station is about a 5 minute walk and easy to use into town. Not centre city but this isn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: JuliettaHolland
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 nights at this hotel, chosen after reading other comments. Generally we would leave in the morning, explore the city and return in the afternoon (between 4 and 5 p.m.) to rest a little and change before going out in the evening. Both days, when we arrived at the hotel, our room was not cleaned yet. When we complained at the reception, they told us that they were sorry but they were dealing with a large group! While we were paying € 160 a night. Both a written complaint and an e-mail to the hotel afterwords, did not supply any reaction from this hotel.Unbelieveable!! Other than that, the neighbourhood was nice (typical Spanish) and the center was easy to reach by metro. Barcelona was great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: DoireEire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here april 2008, lovely hotel in a lovely area. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,Not a nice location!”
Reviews.Author: mondo12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in september for 4 nights, the hotel itself is quiet nice,everything is clean and modern and the free mini bar was a first for me! My big problem with this place is the location,it is on the outskirts of the city in a very run down part of town,the reason we picked this hotel was it proximity to the beach apart from that it does not have a whole lot else going for it. On more than one occasion we felt unsafe walking in this neighbourhood espeically at night ,the area seems to attract a few ladies of the night! If I was going to Barcelona again I would not stay here, I would head up to somewhere closer to port Olympic.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Lana081
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Confortel Barcelona. We were very satisfied with the hotel. It was spotless and the staff was very courteous. It is located 5-10 minute walking distance to the beach and a 10 minute walking distance to the subway. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay very close to the beach. Also the "double bed" is actually a king size bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamCoventry
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a roof top pool & patio area for sunbathing. Free beach towels & water are provided. The pool is quite small, but very stylish & you can see the sea (which is less 5 mins walk away). The hotel is modern minimalist style with funky furniture & dark wooden or tiled floors. There is a Free mini bar in the room which is re'stocked with beer, juice, coke & water every day. The hotel staff are very friendly. We´ve had a great stay, 1st week in sept 08 in Confortel Barcelona. The hotel is next to Ramblas Poblenou which has cafe bars & restaurants along the centre and lots of shops & paterisseries to buy a cheap breakfast if you just want a croissant. I´d recommend going here if you want a holiday in barclona nr the beach rather than the hustle & bustle of Las Ramblas. I wasn´t sure if it wasn´t going to be too far from the centre, but it wasn´t at all, the nearest metro is only 3 streets away (less than 5 mins walk) and you can buy a 10 trip metro pass for 7 euros which means getting into the centre is really easy. I´ve stayed on las ramblas before & I much preferred staying here.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Steinunn
Reviews.Content: I was there in the middle of july with my friend and i found it a very good hotel. Brand new and wery fancy. The breakfast was good and was open until 10.30 wich was good if you wanted to sleep. The hotel is situaed in an old industry neighbourhood so the area isn't that exciting but it is very short to the beach only 5 min. the beach was called bogatell and was wery good. we alwais took metro downtow to catalonia square. the metro is about 7 minutes away. This was a wery queed neigborhood. We one time walked to the rambla and the Kolumbus memorial and that took us about 45 min. it is wery shoort to the olympic port and there you can find good restaurants. We ate at La Fonda, very good Paella. Pizza hut was also on that port if you're more to fast food. But the rooms and service at the hotel was exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few teething problems”
Reviews.Author: Kieferzoidy
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my friend late July and I was very happy with the overall experience. First off, it's at the complete opposite end of Ramon Turro than I first thought, so don't do like we did and get off at Ciutadella Metro station, and instead stay on till Llacuna, which is only a a 5minute walk from the hotel (as opposed to well over 30 minutes). Secondly, we got there, the staff were very nice and friendly, and the hotel looked clean and tidy - the only blip came when they had booked us in a double room instead of a twin, but I can't tell if this was the fault of the hotel, hotels.com or just a blip with their booking form. But 20 minutes later we were switched into another room and the problem solved. So other than that it was all plain sailing for us - the hotel was kept clean and tidy, with the maids cleaning every day (around 10:30) on the first floor. New towels were provided and the mini bar restocked. And true to their word, it was complimentary. So each day we got a diet coke, a coke, 2 water bottles, 2 fizzy water, a light beer, a normal beer and 2 fruit juices. Which is quite handy. The rooms were nice and quiet too. There is supposed to be free Wi-fi but it wasn't working with my psp, but I don't know whether that was down to my PSP or the hotel. But then again there were 3/4 PC's down in the lobby that had free internet access if needed. The pool on the roof isn't huge, but if there's only a couple of people in it, it's good enough to cool down and waste some time in. We spent a bit of time up on the roof in the pool and by the side and it was pleasant. And like the picture shows you can see the sea! Ahh the beach - literally a 5 minute walk in a straight line from the hotel, so I liked it's positioning. If you need to go across town the Metro works well. As for food we didn't use the restaurant but the road that runs down the side of the hotel was filled with cafes and bars that do a coffee and croissant for 2 Euros. Just walk along Ramon Turro heading away from the centre and its the first road you come across. Check out was 12pm and they held our bags for us untill we needed them, and I felt the service was good. But as the heading implies I think the newness is still a minor issue for the hotel - ie they don't tell you the lift doesn't go anywhere unless you swipe your card. If they provided a bit more info it would be great. I think that's the important stuff, overall I would recommend the hotel.
